meta.name: Route and categorize Gmail emails to Slack with Llama 3 via OpenRouter

nodes.name: Invite a user to a channel

parameters.text:
=You are an email categorization assistant.

IMPORTANT DEFINITIONS:
- "accounts" is ONLY for financial, billing, payments, invoices, taxes, subscriptions, or accounting-related emails.
- Login, security, authentication, OTP, two-factor authentication (2FA), password reset, or access-related emails MUST NOT be classified as "accounts".
- Security, login, or access-related emails MUST be classified as "internal".

Step 1:
If the email fits one of the predefined categories, select it.

Predefined categories:
- sales        ‚Üí leads, deals, demos, pricing, proposals
- marketing    ‚Üí campaigns, newsletters, promotions
- product      ‚Üí feature updates, roadmap, product feedback
- engineering  ‚Üí bugs, errors, deployments, technical issues
- ai           ‚Üí LLMs, ML models, AI tools, AI research
- internal     ‚Üí authentication, login alerts, security, OTP, 2FA, password reset, internal notifications
- accounts     ‚Üí invoices, billing, payments, subscriptions, accounting, taxes

Step 2:
If NONE apply, propose a NEW category name.

Rules for new category:
- lowercase
- hyphen-separated
- max 1 word
- max 30 characters

Email subject:
{{$json.subject}}

Email body:
{{$json.text}}

Return ONLY valid JSON:
{
  "category": "<category>"
}

parameters.includeFields: id, text, textAsHtml, subject, date, to, from, threadId

parameters.content:
##  Gmail Intake & Data Preparation

* The Gmail node runs every minute to check for newly received emails that are still in an unread state. It is configured to ignore spam and draft emails.

* The Code node filters emails based on email IDs. It checks whether the email is from trusted sources and whether an unread email notification has already been sent to the Slack channel. If a notification was already sent, it passes an empty JSON to the next node.

* The If node checks whether the incoming data is empty. Only if data is present does the workflow proceed further.

* The Edit Fields node removes unnecessary data from the response and retains only the required fields, allowing the AI node to process the data more efficiently.

## AI Email Categorization

* The AI Agent node reads the email content and determines its category (for example, Sales, Accounts, etc.).

* A predefined list of categories is included in the prompt. If the email matches one of these, the corresponding category name is returned; otherwise, a new category name is generated.

* The implementation uses OpenRouter‚Äôs LLaMA chat model for classification.

## Merge Node ( Merge Category)

* This node merges the category identified by the AI agent into the main data returned by the ‚ÄúArrange Email Data‚Äù node.

## Slack Channels

* The Slack node is used to retrieve the list of Slack channels.
* The first Code node formats the channel list data returned by the Slack node.
* The second Code node filters the formatted channel data, removes duplicate entries, and checks for a matching channel name based on the category provided by the AI agent node.
* If a matching channel is found, it returns found: true.

## Channel Existence Check

* This If node checks whether a matching category was found in the previous node.
* If found is true, it proceeds with the Existing Channel Flow.
* Otherwise, it triggers the New Channel Creation Flow.

## Existing Channel Flow

* The Join Slack Channel node is used to join the app to the matched channel if it has not already joined.
* The next Slack node posts the email details to the matched channel. The message body is structured using Block Kit (blocks) to support reply-via-button email functionality, which can be implemented through another workflow.
* In message body pass email thread id in button block so ii will used in reply functionality

## New Channel Creation Flow

* It first creates a Slack channel using the category name identified by the AI agent. If the category exists in the predefined category list, that name is used; otherwise, a new channel is created using the AI-generated category name.
* Next, it invites the current user to the newly created channel so they can send and view messages.
- Finally, a Slack node posts the email details to the channel using Block Kit (blocks) format, including a reply button, whose functionality will be implemented through a separate workflow trigger.

nodes.name: Remove Duplicate Channel + Find Matched Channel

parameters.content:
## Prerequisite and Setup Guide

### How it works
* This workflow automatically monitors new unread emails in Gmail and routes them to the correct Slack channel using AI-based categorization. It starts by listening for incoming emails while ignoring spam and drafts. The email content (sender, subject, body, and metadata) is cleaned and prepared so it can be processed efficiently.
* An AI agent analyses the email content and determines the most relevant category (such as Sales, Accounts, Support, HR, etc.) based on a predefined category list. If a valid category is detected, it is normalized and merged back into the main email data.
* Next, the workflow fetches the list of existing Slack channels and checks whether a channel matching the detected category already exists.
* If the channel exists, the workflow joins the app to that channel (if needed) and posts the email details.
* If the channel does not exist, a new channel is created using the category name, the current user is invited, and the email details are posted.
* All Slack messages are sent using Block Kit, allowing future enhancements such as reply-via-email buttons or follow-up workflows.

### Setup steps
1. Gmail Configuration
   * Connect a Gmail account using OAuth and allow access to unread emails and metadata.
2. AI / LLM Configuration
   * Configure an AI provider (OpenAI or compatible) and ensure the prompt restricts output to predefined categories.
3. Slack Configuration
   * Create a Slack App with required scopes (channels, chat, users) and add the Bot OAuth token to n8n.
4. Testing & Activation
   * Activate the workflow, send test emails, and verify correct categorization, channel handling, and Slack notifications.

main.node: Remove Duplicate Channel + Find Matched Channel
